reviews.review_msg: Attendance mandatory but I feel like I don't really get anything useful from the lectures so I recommend leaving halfway after writing my name on the attendance sheet. Just read the assigned readings and get a firm grip on what your topic is for your paper. She's a generous (easy) marker and super approachable with questions.

Even though the course was online and the workload may be heavy, I found her prerecorded lectures informative and extremely useful in getting through the course; some of these reviews feel like they were written by people who honestly can't handle self-directed learning. Sophie is a pleasure to have for in-person lectures!

This class is just awful. I took it because it's a mandatory class for my program but it was probably in the top 2 worst classes I've taken at SFU. Really, DO NOT take it unless you have to. Readings are interesting but course is extremely uningaging. The marking scheme is unclear and the TA marked unnecessarily harsh with little feedback.

The class content is interesting in the sense of books and topics we are focusing on. However, for an online class, the syllabus was hard to follow and disorganized. Every week has a big chunk of material to go over, like reading a whole book or watching a 2hr movie. I would recommend it to someone that doesn't have a heavy course load.
